definition: to exercise forbearance/patient and accommodating
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
submissive/accommodating

sentences.english: It's important to be tolerant with each other.
I think that person can not blindly self-surrender, for example, to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲做人不可以一味的忍讓，比如說交朋友。

sentences.english: As I grow, I’m more inclined to adopt a “roll with the punches” attitude.
sentences.chinese: 在我的成長中，我更傾向於採取“忍讓”態度。

sentences.english: Tolerance and accommodation can prevent disputes; Gentleness and great love can transform disasters into blessings.
sentences.chinese: 忍讓可避免爭執，柔和大愛可轉禍爲福。

sentences.english: I used to be naughty, Haide you told me the patience and time.
sentences.chinese: 以前是我淘氣，害得你對我一次次的忍讓。

sentences.english: My flatmate is very messy, but I still put up with him.
sentences.chinese: 我的室友很髒亂，但我還是忍讓他。

sentences.english: Chinese believe that self-surrender is a good virtue.
sentences.chinese: 中國人認爲忍讓是美德。

sentences.english: We must bear with her during this difficult period.
sentences.chinese: 在此困難時期，我們對她一定要忍讓。

sentences.english: It has to be a two-way street.
sentences.chinese: 一條雙向道，有來有往，引申爲互相忍讓。

sentences.english: They practice respect and humility, tolerance, and self-criticism.
sentences.chinese: 他們在實踐中具有尊重，忍讓和自我批判的品格。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to modestly decline
lenient/tolerant/indulgent/charitable/to forgive
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to show off/to try to be brave
considerate (of other people's needs)
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
a dispute/to wrangle
double standard
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
calm/cool-headed
